title: Defect-Security | Driver-Broken Authentication | Able to update the Subscription Setting anonymously

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

How would an attacker get the link you are using in your example in order to alter this setting for another user?  The IDs used in that link are far too long and complex to guess or brute force, so are you saying that they are leaked somewhere?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

How would an attacker get the link you are using in your example in order to alter this setting for another user? The IDs used in that link are far too long and complex to guess or brute force, so are you saying that they are leaked somewhere?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Hi Josh,

First of all thanks for the update and i agree with you on this that id used in the issue are too complex too guess which makes brute forcing very difficult.
And yes there is possibility of information leakage below mentioned scenarios helped in the information leakage of ids

Possible attacking scenario here would be :

Scenario one 

1:Victim logged in application, for his/her ease to go back to same functionality, copied the subscription link

2:At the same time he might be chatting with someone 

3:There might be a possibility that he mistakenly shares that url on chat with other person 


Scenario two 

1:If victim is in cyber cafe and gets logged out of the application(uber) from his/her system then attacker comes on the same system and able to fetch through the browser history (since no authorization check is present on the same url)


-For more clarification i have attached screenshots related  screnario two


2:Since the IDs  are sensitive information (i.e. related to authenticated user)are travelling and getting revealed in url

-my suggestion any user specific sensitive information should travel in the parameters of the body of request & not in url of the application

Scenario two

-For more clarification i have attached screenshots related screnario two

2:Since the IDs are sensitive information (i.e. related to authenticated user)are travelling and getting revealed in url

-my suggestion any user specific sensitive information should travel in the parameters of the body of request & not in url of the application

activities.message:
Thank you for followup.

Please keep in mind that per our [program rules](https://hackerone.com/uber), issues which require physical access to a victim’s computer (access to another user's history), are not eligible for a bounty reward via this program.  The ability to unsubscribe any email address is an accepted business risk that we are already aware of. For this reason I'm closing to close this as Informative but please let us know if you find anything else!

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for followup.

Please keep in mind that per our program rules, issues which require physical access to a victim’s computer (access to another user's history), are not eligible for a bounty reward via this program. The ability to unsubscribe any email address is an accepted business risk that we are already aware of. For this reason I'm closing to close this as Informative but please let us know if you find anything else!

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

vulnerability_information_html:
Steps to execute the issue/defect

1:Logged into account on domain (https://riders.uber.com) with one of the accounts (account type-Driver)

2:Now go to Manage your email subscription settings and note the link mentioned below

-View the subscription setting (i.e. subscription setting Uber Global Updates -checked)

-note the url -https://subscriptions.uber.com/user/483c39a2-9e7a-43fb-91a4-980370aa45c3/e911dd42abea2617e625d2547de8038a3e9a42b47097ad570d4b68b1ce25dba9?_ga=1.134668273.1418643578.1461496136

3:Now go to another browser where no authentication is done, now open the same url in Google Chrome

4:After link got opened, now going to modify the subscription setting -(i.e. subscription setting Uber Global Updates -Unchecked)

5:Now Again go to Browser Firefox and refresh the same url as a result of previous step subscription setting got updated

i.e. Uber Global Updates gets -Unchecked from checked

I am successfully able to update the Subscription Setting of an authenticated user anonymously
vulnerability_information:
Steps to execute the issue/defect

1:Logged into account on domain (https://riders.uber.com) with one of the accounts (account type-Driver)

2:Now go to Manage your email subscription settings and note the link mentioned below


-View the subscription setting (i.e. subscription setting Uber Global Updates -checked)

-note the url -https://subscriptions.uber.com/user/483c39a2-9e7a-43fb-91a4-980370aa45c3/e911dd42abea2617e625d2547de8038a3e9a42b47097ad570d4b68b1ce25dba9?_ga=1.134668273.1418643578.1461496136

3:Now go to another browser where no authentication is done, now open the same url in Google Chrome

4:After link got opened, now going to modify the subscription setting -(i.e. subscription setting Uber Global Updates -Unchecked)


5:Now Again go to Browser Firefox and refresh the same url as a result of previous step subscription setting got updated

i.e. Uber Global Updates  gets  -Unchecked  from checked


I am successfully able to update the Subscription Setting of an authenticated user anonymously
